Primary Contact: Andrea Sage; Phone: 250.317.9864; Fax: 250.763.1483; Email: andrea.sage@jhscso.bc.ca
Service Details: - Serves as an employment training for adults with disabilities (18+) with the intent to support them for the food service industry- Consists of 6 months of employment readiness and skill development that includes relevant certification, and hands-on paid employment in the cafe- Participants can earn First Aid/CPR, Foodsafe, WHMIS, and WorldHost certificates- Participants will develop a range of skills including customer services, point of sale, and barista training * catering and delivery are available
Eligibility: Ages: 18 year(s) and upFor ages 18 or older, ineligible for EI or Reachback status, may be on Income Assistance, PWD, CPP-D, have reasonable communication/comprehension skills, have an identifiable disability and experiencing barriers to employment, and are physically capable and motivated to work
How to Apply: - Forms available from the website- Ffax or email completed Referral Forms to 250.763.1483 or employmentservices@jhscso.bc.ca to the attention of Employment Services- Referrals accepted from community agencies and individuals who self-refer
Address & Map: 1440 St. Paul StKelowna, BC     V1Y 2E6View MapQuest Map
Major Intersection: St Paul St and Bernard Ave
Languages: English ; Can access interpreter if needed
